articles.title: Hit With $3.2B EU Fine as Trump Threatens Tariffs
articles.description: The European Commission has fined Alphabet’s Google (GOOG) €2.95 billion, or about $3.2 billion, for what it calls abuse in its online advertising business. The case centers on what regulators describe as “self-preferencing,” where Google gave its own ad serv…

articles.author: Rian Howlett
articles.title: Stock market today: S&P 500, Nasdaq, Dow rise as Wall Street looks ahead to inflation reality check
articles.description: Investors look forward to a light week of reports and earnings, with inflation data taking center stage.
articles.content:
US stocks moved mostly higher on Monday as investors set their sights on inflation data later this week to provide a reality check on the chances of a jumbo interest-rate cut in September.
